intro: Alsine sintenisii, commonly known as the Sintenis' sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its low, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are succulent and adapted to conserve water, making it well-suited for harsh, dry environments. Alsine sintenisii is often found in sandy or gravelly soils, thriving in full sun.
